name: QT Gold Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: QT hotels have such a great first impression. The staff have retro beachy outfits that really make you feel like you're somewhere special.
reviews.title: Stylish and fun retro hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior design really is impressive, from the lobby through to the rooms. The free fresh lemonade in the room is a nice touch. The rooms are a standard size, nicely renovated and as fun as the lobby. The hotel bar is very popular - we are tequila buffs and they have an amazing number of tequilas and cocktails which were very impressive.
reviews.title: Very Cool!!

reviews.text: The restaurant, Bazaar, is really worth experiencing. We went for breakfast and found it to be really unique. It is a buffet style but not your typical hotel style. Without giving too much away, you really should have one meal here. We found the breakfast buffet to be great value.
reviews.title: Querky looking hotel - everything else average!

reviews.text: The only reason we can't give this hotel a rating of 5 is that the hotel is slightly dated. They can paint the place and apply the most lavish of decorations, but the hotel structure is still older which is noticeable on your balcony and in the pool area. This does not take away from the overall experience nor our love for this hotel (this was our third time here - sorry for late review!). We love the QT brand and look forward to staying here again, as well as their other properties.
reviews.title: Cool but not intimidating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here back in August with my bf for only one night, but we wished we could have had a few more days! We loved how cool the place looks, from the entry down to the little touches (like beach bags with thongs in the room), even the groovy uniforms on the staff! Initially I feared that this hotel would hurt my eyes after a while with all the colour, but it was quite the opposite! I couldn't stop looking at all of the different areas the hotel has to offer. The rooms were lovely, big comfy beds, great views, and most of the decor was for sale if you want to take some of the hotel home.
reviews.title: Very modern, clean but if your dont mind the service

reviews.text: Loved the place. Loved the feel of it and it gave a fun atmosphere. Wasn't too far from the main strip and received really friendly service. Would definitely stay there again. Very clean and the rooms where really great and funky.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked for a week here after reading great reviews, but we have to admit we were disappointed. The hotel itself, and our room, were great - funky, bright and clean, but we often didn't have our toiletries re-stocked each day and were surprised to have to pay for the coffee in our room.
reviews.title: Rather disappointing

reviews.text: On arrival, we were given a voucher for a drink in the Stingray bar, only to found that it was for precisely that - ONE free drink per couple!
reviews.title: Excellent. Modern, hip & funky hotel

reviews.text: For most of our stay, we had very noisy neighbours who often had a room full of people and played their music loudly. In all, we had to contact the reception several times to ask them to resolve the issue, but this seemed to be done in a very half-hearted way; in the end, we just put up with it.
reviews.title: Fun from the minute you walk in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Stingray bar most evenings before heading out in to Surfer's, but on one evening we were refused admission as my husband was wearing shorts - although they were smart, dress shorts, and much smarter than those wearing jeans in the bar! Obviously, as paying guests, we found this rather insulting so didn't bother visiting the bar for the remainder of our stay.
reviews.title: Amazing place, perfect stay

reviews.text: This is a great value hotel for its location and I really enjoy all the quirky design features - which is backed up by friendly and efficient service. The standout feature though is Bazaar Restaurant - which has a great breakfast and an even better dinner. I would return just for dinner!
reviews.title: Loved the quirky design features

reviews.text: I recently stayed here with a friend in one of the King Suites. After reading some of the reviews, my heart sank a little when we were told our room was on level 7 - I had read that many people were disappointed with the 'ocean view' from anything below level 9. I couldn't have been more wrong! The view was fabulous and completely unobstructed and the room was beautiful and spacious. We had the misfortune of visiting the Gold Coast during the storm surge from ex-cyclone Oswald but the comfort of the room and the friendly staff made it an enjoyable experience. There was some minor water ingress in our room from the balcony door and there was some leaking throughout the hotel but as a Queenslander I can appreciate that Surfers Paradise (and anything south of Rockhampton frankly) isn't built to withstand such extreme weather, so I can't really hold that against them. Buffett breakfast was absolutely incredible and I would highly recommend dinner at the Bazaar restaurant on at least one night of your stay. Wait staff are firnedly and helpful, food is devine and the atmosphere is electric - there was even a proposal a few tables over during our dinner! If you like a cheeky cocktail, light meal and some bubbles you must visit the Stingray bar - a true testament to it's service and value is the large number of locals who drink there. My only disappointment was that you had to pay for coffee in the room (mind you, it is a Nespresso machine not a kettle and instant coffee!) and that there was no milk supplied even if I had wanted to shell out $1.50 for a pod of coffee. In my opinion, better off walking downstairs and ordering a latte from the cafe. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Great staff, fabulous restaurant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely and the views spectacular but clearly the best part about QT is the very retro cool renovation that has created the funkiest ground floor of any hotel on the Coast. I liked the little unusual touches - instead of standard white paper and pens in the room they left black paper and a white pencil and some interesting things in the mini bar. great to see some thought and innovation.
reviews.title: Possibly the funkiest hotel on the Coast

reviews.text: A big surprise - refurbished hotel now with very quirky & stylish rooms/general areas. The staff in all areas could not have been more friendly & helpful. Its a great couples & family place - kids are looked after but not in your face - ill be back
reviews.title: Quirky & very friendly
Recommended
reviews.text: Don't pass on the QT Gold Coast on your next holiday, especially with such attractive rates. We have just returned from a mediocre holiday due to an ex tropical cyclone and thank goodness we had a fantastic place to hang out as the beaches were closed.

We stayed as a family at QT in two standard rooms on our last night after a trip to Byron Bay and we found the hotel was superb - we loved the funky vibe and having all the ingredients in your room to make your own lemonade was a great touch
reviews.title: Good Value on the Gold Coast with a funky vibe

reviews.text: We didn't try Bazzarr as it was booked up but it looked amazing and it seems to be a real hit with the locals
reviews.title: Funky hotel shame about the staff

reviews.text: Great comfy beds - a really good choice for a Gold Coast bolt-hole without paying big sums of money
reviews.title: Stingray Bar-Worst Service

reviews.text: Stayed for an early valentines day but they stuffed up our booking when we rescheduled from previous weekend due to weather the staff at the desk were rude about it asking me who I spoke to change the booking as it I was lying with which I responded , reservations I thought that was crazy who takes the name down when calling reservations. They certainly pick the staff to look like flight attendants rather than provide genuine service don't expect friendly smiles here only steel faced stares from the gaudy ladies at the front desk.
reviews.title: QT Hotel Gold Coast on a winner

reviews.text: All that aside he rules are spectacular but it doesn't mean much if you don't get the service. Rydges Melbourne is streets ahead of this place !
reviews.title: Funky Fun

description: With an enviable location easy walking distance to the beach, Cavill Avenue shopping and the entertainment district, QT Gold Coast blends first class service with inspired facilities. Formerly the Gold Coast International Hotel, QT Gold Coast is a designer hotel haven unlike anything Surfer’s Paradise has seen before. Relax in our revamped pool area, energise on one of two newly re-topped tennis courts or indulge in the all new market place style Bazaar restaurant after sipping a coastal cocktail creation from Stingray Lounge.
